full_summary:
### Grain and Abrasive Items Procurement
#### Reference Number: cb-974-84594344
#### Solicitation Number: W8485-258172/A
#### Publication Date: May 3, 2024
#### Tender Closing Date: June 3, 2024 at 14:00:00
#### Expected Contract Start Date: June 24, 2024
#### Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2025

The Department of National Defence is undertaking a procurement project for Grain and Abrasive items. The tender process is open to all eligible suppliers. The items required are detailed below:

* 80 units of Grain, Abrasive (5350, NSN: 5350-01-369-8032) to be delivered to 25 CFSD Montreal by mid-August 2024.
* Bidders proposing an Equivalent or Substitute Product must indicate the brand name, model and/or Part Number and the NCAGE they are offering.

It is essential to note that due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Department of National Defence strongly encourages bidders to transmit their bids electronically using the ePost Connect service instead of traditional methods.

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender is open to bidders who have signed agreements under the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement.

**Notice of Proposed Procurement:**

The contract will be awarded based on the lowest price method. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Bid Documents:**

The bid documents can be downloaded from the following URL: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/37563/w8485-258172.a---request-for-proposal-%28en---canada-buys.pdf

**Language and Submitting Bid Documents:**

Bid documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada, English or French.

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact MCpl Poissant-Viau at audree.poissant-viau@forces.gc.ca.

MSC does nothing but attempt to make the information more "professional" and readable for a CCB audience. 
All other work is done by AI. 
No grammar or spelling mistakes where there were none. 
I will mention where the sources and the references are in
